data.title: Last (or first) frame of WithBuildingPlacedOverlay overlays idle overlay
data.body: Currently only visibly affects the TS construction yard.

data.title: Dune2 ICON.ICN and ICON.MAP sprites loader
data.body:
CHANGELOG:
- Added dune2 ICON.ICN and ICON.MAP sprites loader

For test, just put original DUNE.PAK in ~^Content/d2k folder and modify mod.yaml to contain:

```
Packages:
        DUNE.PAK
```

and

```
SpriteFormats: R8, ShpTD, TmpRA, IcnD2
```

![screen shot 2015-09-11 at 15 05 13](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3105609/9816091/65023c7e-58a3-11e5-99e4-d192a94c7d46.png)

data.title: Generic WithRangeCircle

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
Replaces `RenderRangeCircle`, `RenderDetectionCircle`, `RenderShroudCircle`, and `RenderJammerCircle` as well as providing range circles for `BaseProvider`, weapons (through armaments), and armaments (regardless of whether attacking is enabled).

Also gives control over `Color` and `ContrastColor` of the range circles providing color scheme control by modders.

Uses provider type and option variant filter for selecting ranges provided by other traits. The `Name` field controls the circle group - range circles (with the same name) of other actors are shown when placing.

Provided types:

```
weapon: range of weapon from armament with name matching variant
armament: range of armament(s)
    [with name matching variant]
targets: range of armaments
    [with a certain valid target type]
attack-armament: like armament except show only if able to attack
attacks: like targets except show only if able to attack
detect: range of cloak detection
    [with variant as one of the cloak types detected]
shroud: range of shroud generated
jams: range of all jamming
    missiles: range of missile jamming
    radar: range of radar jamming
```

The fields `Name`, `Type`, and `Variant` might be more understandable with different names:

```
Name => Circles | CircleGroup | Group
Type => Filter | Provider
Variant => Subfilter | Filter
```

data.title: the ant faction
data.body:
Hey,
the goal of this issue it to collect information about the ants.
I'm sure you all know the ant easteregg from the original.
I was wondering how much work would it be to create a little ant faction from the assets.
So I made a little research:

As much as I know there are these files in openra:
- ant.shp
- anticon.shp  (Giant Ant)
- antbite.aud
- antdie.aud
- hill01.tem
- lar1.shp
- lar2.shp
- quee.shp

Future more I found these 3 icons while digging in some maps:
- ant1icon.shp (Gigant Ant)
- ant2icon.shp (Fire Ant)
- ant3icon.shp (Warrior Ant)

and some ant information:
http://ra.afraid.org/html/ra/a_csgawt.html

because we only have 1 ant.shp I guess the ants got colored by coding in the original game. Somebody said to me that the fire ants just used the red of soviets.

If you imagine 2 player using an ant faction this simple recoloring might not work. I Suggest the eyes of the ants should be the player color and the rest should give information about the kind of ant. I Don't know if that is possible. and this might also require some new ant.shps.

Anyway here is the big idea:
- Create a mobile construction ant queen by modifying the queen asset that can deploy to an anthill (Maybe unable to undeploy) . Yes that's not easy, and we might need a 3d approache here. Any 3dsmax artist volunteers?
- The queen assest has tiny wings, so she might can fly?
- Create some very basic ant buildings: Anthill (6cell),  SmallAntHill(4cell barraks&refinery), Anthole (1cell powerplant)
- Giant ants should take the roll as harvesters and also as an early attack uni, build able only at the 6cell hill
- Giant ants can unload the ore at the 6cell and 4cell anthill holes
- The ant hole building could be something like an air condition hole and give few power, that you need to build a lot of them. (1cell building). Maybe adding some little building range to it to get them spread out like crazy basewalk.
- The 4cell ant hill can produce fire ants, warriors and queens
- Ants need something to counters air, maybe a fourth flying ant unit that's like a longbow, 
  or only queens can be used as anti air. not yet sure...
- Buildings will need some building in Progress Animations this is where the larvae could get used
- I thought about using larvae as resources or like zerg larvae (but I'm against that)
- I also don't like that the queen used the tesla zap.

Yeah, something like that.

concept of a 4Cell: Ant hill  
![screenshot 2015-09-05 01 33 36](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5147014/9806918/b2288510-584b-11e5-955c-c39ca71b6f6c.png)

btw: if you have any other ant stuff. drop it here.

data.title: Tiered pathing
data.body:
An alternative (or maybe complementary) solution to #3241.

Divide the map into a coarse-grained grid of cell block nodes and only switch to finer-grained pathing once close enough to the target cell(s).

data.title: Update soviet01.lua
data.body: Changed the increment to 1 rather than the var

data.title: Eagerly cache traits in Actor
data.body:
In this case, removing the lazy generation buys us more performance in removing the overhead of accessing these values than we lose from avoided computation when these values are never accessed.

Caching these traits in the constructor is essentially free and this saves us 1% in CPU by not having to access everything through the indirection of Lazy<T>.Value.

[Diff ignoring whitespace](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9313/files?w=1)

data.title: turret-move animation?
data.body:
I'm trying to make a mech .shp for OpenRA - it has animated legs and a turret, taken from a separate .shp file

The problem is: the turret simply stays at its position, while it should move relatively to the central mount during the walk animation, e.g. - 
![2-timbgren](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13980246/9783025/ee1b6b78-57a1-11e5-995a-7797d90a7d91.gif)

What are the options to implement this? Is it possible to define a specific move animation for turrets? Or do the voxel turrets behave differently from sprites?

this is my base file - ![mc1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13980246/9782995/b1af3d36-57a1-11e5-8bd5-fc7c37f9f198.gif)

data.title: DeathType Count check in Explodes
data.body: Fixes #9310.

data.title: Demo trucks don't explode when destroyed
data.body: They only explode when deployed. This is in current bleed.

data.title: Add margin to CreateEffectWarhead air check
data.body:
Instead of considering the ImpactType to be "Air" as soon as the warhead triggers even a single Z WDist above 0 (relative to terrain height), there is now a small margin. This fixes the issue that #9016 originally attempted to fix, namely that missiles sometimes show the "air" explosion even though they were shot at a ground target.

Fixes #9308.

data.title: Missiles sometimes trigger Air impact type when targeting ground
data.body:
This is what #9016 attempted to fix.
On bleed, the issue is only really noticable in TS, and it doesn't happen all the time. The best shot at reproducing it is shooting at various directions on the ground with bazooka infantry.
It can be reproduced more reliably with my `BallisticMissile` projectile in TDX (even the old betas from May), where it actually happens more often. That also means it is not a recent regression, but probably never (visibly) triggers in the shipping mods because in the 3 shipping mods missiles usually start at rather low altitude already and reach Z = 0 before "CloseEnough" triggers due to the Tan flight curve.
But the higher the projectile speed and starting altitude (or the lower the MaximumPitch), the more likely the issue comes up.

The issue becomes much more frequent and reproducable with #8717 as well, due to the different flight curve.

data.title: Make some navigation keys available to spectators
data.body:
This will make the following keys available to spectators and in replays:
- Center screen on last event/beacon [Space]
- Center screen on current selection [Home]
- Cycle construction yards [H]
- Cycle production buildings [Tab]

The latter two need a player view to work, the former two work in all views.

We may or may not want the first commit, please discuss. At the very least the `LocalPlayer`->`RenderPlayer` change from that commit should be kept, though.

Fixes #6174.

data.title: Map upgrade parameters aren't self-explanatory
data.body:
This map works in release and playtest but is not supported in bleed:
http://resource.openra.net/maps/4219

Utility crashes when I try to upgrade map to bleed. Check-yaml gives the following errors:

```
Testing map: GreatTreeDivide
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Missing Type: TargetableBuildingInfo
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Missing Type: TargetableBuildingInfo
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Actor CustomHeliHusk is not defined by any rule.
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Actor CustomMammothHusk is not defined by any rule.
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Actor CustomHarvesterHusk is not defined by any rule.
```

data.title: Rules.ini and Art.ini to MiniYaml converters
data.body:
The tileset import is a huge success. As TS/RA2 mods have a lot of assets, setting those up manually can take some time. Tasks like setting up basic stats like hitpoints, reveal range, building footprint, overlays are easily automatizable. https://github.com/LipkeGu/CNC-INI-Converter could need a C# conversion, code cleanup and then get integrated as a utility command.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/26548620-rules-ini-and-art-ini-to-miniyaml-converters?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Make AttackBase.GetMinimumRange() return WDist.Zero if there are no available armaments
data.body: This applies similar logic to that of `AttackBase.GetMaximumRange()`. Actually, the current version of `AttackBase.GetMinimumRange()` should crash if there are not any armaments where `IsTraitDisabled` is false.

data.title: order-spam exploits
data.body:
you can raise this APM just by selecting a unit and making a right click on the map ... over and over again ... this somewhat distorts the result we are looking for i assume ... 

doing a right-click with a extern program just makes this ridiculous ... and this is something people can use to create the illusion of a lag ingame  ... selecting a ton of units (infantry) and then doing random clicks on the map ... slows the game down to a point where it is unplayable and not enjoyable , and people (your enemy that was about to win) just leave the game ... 

![autoactions](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9139965/9748452/0e667896-5685-11e5-8dae-3ca61d65cf9f.png)

data.title: Reduce allocations
data.body:
A couple more small tweaks to reduce allocations and thus reduce the work the GC has to do.

These changes save about ~8% in allocations during the main game loop in an AI heavy replay.

data.title: Make Range WDist for all traits with circular ranges.
Removed a redundant bot production debug message
data.body: This is spammy and not really useful, because a) you can already see this via the observer tools and b) it is announced in the line before which tracks the prioritizing and decision making `AI: {0} decided to build {1}: Priority override` or `{0} decided to build {1}: Desired is {2} ({3} / {4}); current is {5} / {4}` so we can just skip this and keep an overview in the already crowded bot debug lines.

data.title: TD: support TriggerPowerOutage()
data.body: fixes #9291

data.title: Create abstract class AffectsShroud[Info] with RevealsShroud core logic also used by CreatesShroud
data.body: Closes  #9297.

data.title: CreatesShroud inherits from RevealsShroud, but are functionally disjoint.
Speed up Player.CanViewActor
data.body:
Create Actor.CanBeViewedByPlayer and simply call this instead. The actor can cache all trait lookups on construction to avoid them being repeated for every visibility check.

This approximately doubles the speed of Player.CanViewActor, which is useful since it gets called a lot from the radar widget (which checks all actors with a radar signature) and when "Always Show Health Bars" is enabled (which checks all selectable actors).

data.title: Use HashSets for AI
data.body:
There are a few `.Contains` checks involving these.

Not sure whether this has any tangible benefits (or unwanted side-effects), but i thought putting this up for review wouldn't hurt.

data.title: Remove Shroud.IsVisibleTest and IsExploredTest
data.body: These are no longer any faster than the regular checks, so there's no need to keep them.

data.title: Speed up RepairIndicator.Render.
data.body: Check repairer count first, as this is quicker than checking fog visibility.

data.title: Fix an infinite loop that occurs when a silo is captured
data.body: Introduced in #9189's 69d062495cd46fff35de1fe229e16cab53b797d2

data.title: TD: TriggerPowerOutage() not supported
data.body: This seems to be a RA-specific LUA function, but would be handy for TD C&C64 GDI01: power down the Obelisk for a few seconds after the Powerplants are hit by the airstrike

data.title: Dispose earlier in FixClassicTilesets.
data.body:
Ensure we dispose the stream we opened right away to avoid leaving it open when an exception occurs.

Discovered by Coverity.
